summary: Email correspondence between U.S. federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and two individuals, Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay, regarding scheduling a call to discuss the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. The email includes an attached protective order and shows coordination for a meeting.

persons.name: Nicolas Cassart
persons.context: Email recipient and correspondent who coordinates with SDNY prosecutors to schedule a call regarding the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Nicolas Boulay
persons.context: Copied on emails, identified as partner of Nicolas Cassart, and included in scheduling a call with SDNY prosecutors about the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing federal investigation being conducted by the SDNY prosecutors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of prosecution in the ongoing federal case being handled by the SDNY prosecutors.

connections.description: Referred to as partners in the email correspondence, coordinating together to schedule a call with SDNY prosecutors.
Cassart is being contacted by SDNY prosecutors in relation to their investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
Boulay is being contacted by SDNY prosecutors in relation to their prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled call between SDNY and contacts
events.description: A call was scheduled for Friday, March 5, 2021, between SDNY prosecutors and Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay to discuss the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: SDNY federal prosecutors were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell as of March 2021.
Prosecutors reached out to Nicolas Cassart and Nicolas Boulay to schedule a call regarding the investigation.
A protective order related to the case was entered by the presiding judge and shared via email attachment.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative activity and witness/contact coordination by the SDNY well after Epstein's death.
